member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions
member.summary: Options for CopyObject operations.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.SourceGeneration
member.summary: The generation of the object resource to copy. When not set, the latest generation will be copied.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.Projection
member.summary: The projection to retrieve.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.DestinationPredefinedAcl
member.summary: A predefined set of ACLs for the new object.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.IfGenerationMatch
member.summary: Precondition for copying: the object is only copied if the existing destination object's generation matches the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.IfGenerationNotMatch
member.summary: Precondition for copying: the object is only copied if the existing destination object's generation does not match the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.IfMetagenerationMatch
member.summary: Precondition for copying: the object is only copied if the existing destination object's meta-generation matches the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.IfMetagenerationNotMatch
member.summary: Precondition for copying: the object is only copied if the existing destination object's meta-generation does not match the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.IfSourceGenerationMatch
member.summary: Precondition for copying: the object is only copied if the source object's generation matches the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.IfSourceGenerationNotMatch
member.summary: Precondition for copying: the object is only copied if the source object's generation does not match the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.IfSourceMetagenerationMatch
member.summary: Precondition for copying: the object is only copied if the source object's meta-generation matches the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.IfSourceMetagenerationNotMatch
member.summary: Precondition for copying: the object is only copied if the source object's meta-generation does not match the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.ExtraMetadata
member.summary: Additional object metadata for the new object. This can be used to specify the storage class of the new object, the content type etc. If this property is not set, the existing object metadata will be used unchanged.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.EncryptionKey
member.summary: The encryption key to use for this operation. If this property is null, the will be used instead. Use to remove encryption headers from this request.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions.SourceEncryptionKey
member.summary: The encryption key to use for the source of the copy. If this property is null, the will be used instead. Use if the source is not encrypted.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.Crc32c

Number of bytes to hash

member.summary: The generation to download. When not specified, the latest version is always downloaded.

member.summary: Precondition for download: the object is only downloaded if its generation matches the given value.

member.summary: If non-null, limits the range of bytes of the object to download.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.DownloadObjectOptions.EncryptionKey
member.summary: The encryption key to use for this operation. If this property is null, the will be used instead. Use to remove encryption headers from this request.

member.summary: Returns the URI to use for a download request, appending any options specified by this object.
member.param: Base URI which must end with a query parameter.
member.returns: The URI including the specified options.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.EncryptionKey
member.summary: An AES-256 key passed to the Google Cloud Storage servers via headers to allow objects to be encrypted at rest using a client-supplied key rather than a server-supplied default key.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.EncryptionKey.None
member.summary: A "don't encrypt" key, used in call-specific options to indicate that a particular request should not use encryption even if the client has a default encryption key.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.EncryptionKey.Base64Key
member.summary: The base64 representation of the key. This will always be 45 characters long, or null for .

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.EncryptionKey.Base64Hash
member.summary: The base64 representation of the SHA-256 hash of the key. This will always be 45 characters long, or null for .

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.EncryptionKey.Create(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates an encryption key from the specified raw bytes.
member.param: The raw key data; must be non-null and 32 bytes long.
member.returns: An based on .

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.EncryptionKey.Generate
member.summary: Generates a random encryption key using .
member.returns: A generated encryption key.

member.summary: Adds encryption headers to the specified request, unless this key is ,
member.param: The request to modify. Must not be null.

member.summary: Used to list in "directory mode". Only objects whose names (aside from the prefix) do not contain delimiter will be returned.

member.summary: The number of results to return per page. (This modifies the per-request page size; it does not affect the total number of results returned.)

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.ListObjectsOptions.Versions
member.summary: Controls whether or not multiple versions of an object are listed separately (true) or not (false). The default API behavior is equivalent to setting this to false, but it is still a nullable property to allow the intention of "definitely false" to be separate from "not set".

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedBucketAcl
member.summary: Predefined access control lists (ACLs) that can be specified when creating or updating buckets.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedBucketAcl.AuthenticatedRead
member.summary: Object owner gets owner access, and all authenticated users get reader access.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedBucketAcl.Private
member.summary: Object owner gets owner access.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedBucketAcl.ProjectPrivate
member.summary: Object owner gets owner access, and project team members get access according to their roles.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedBucketAcl.PublicRead
member.summary: Object owner gets owner access, and all users get reader access.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedBucketAcl.PublicReadWrite
member.summary: Object owner gets owner access, and all users get writer access.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedObjectAcl.AuthenticatedRead
member.summary: Object owner gets owner access, and all authenticated users get reader access.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedObjectAcl.BucketOwnerFullControl
member.summary: Object owner gets owner access, and project team owners get owner access.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedObjectAcl.BucketOwnerRead
member.summary: Object owner gets owner access, and project team owners get reader access.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedObjectAcl.Private
member.summary: Object owner gets owner access.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedObjectAcl.ProjectPrivate
member.summary: Object owner gets owner access, and project team members get access according to their roles.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.PredefinedObjectAcl.PublicRead
member.summary: Object owner gets owner access, and all users get reader access.

member.summary: Initiates the resumable upload session by posting to the signed URL and returns the session URI.
member.param: The signed URL which can be used to initiate a resumable upload session. See UrlSigner.ResumableHttpMethod for more information.
The options for the upload operation.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

member.summary: Name for the Coldline storage class.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClasses.Standard
member.summary: Name of the Standard storage class, which is equivalent to Multi-Regional or Regional depending on the location.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClasses.DurableReducedAvailability
member.summary: Name of the Durable Reduced Availability (DRA) storage class. Use of this storage class is not recommended; Regional storage has lower pricing for some operations but otherwise the same pricing structure, and better performance/availability.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient
member.summary: Abstract class providing operations for Google Cloud Storage.

remarks.para: This abstract class is provided to enable testability while permitting additional operations to be added in the future. See and to construct instances; alternatively, you can construct a directly from a .
All instance methods declared in this class are virtual, with an implementation which simply throws . All these methods are overridden in .

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.CopyObject(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions)
member.summary: Creates a copy of an object synchronously, potentially to a different bucket. This method uses the rewriteObject underlying API operation for more flexibility and reliability.
member.param: The name of the bucket containing the object to copy. Must not be null.
The name of the object to copy within the bucket. Must not be null.
The name of the bucket to copy the object to. Must not be null.
The name of the object within the destination bucket. Must not be null.
Additional options for the copy operation. May be null, in which case appropriate defaults will be used.
member.returns: The representation of the new storage object resulting from the copy.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.CopyObjectAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CopyObjectOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a copy of an object synchronously, potentially to a different bucket. This method uses the rewriteObject underlying API operation for more flexibility and reliability.
member.param: The name of the bucket containing the object to copy. Must not be null.
The name of the object to copy within the bucket. Must not be null.
The name of the bucket to copy the object to. Must not be null.
The name of the object within the destination bucket. Must not be null.
Additional options for the copy operation. May be null, in which case appropriate defaults will be used.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation, with a result returning the representation of the new storage object resulting from the copy.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.CreateBucket(System.String,System.String,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CreateBucketOptions)
member.summary: Creates a storage bucket synchronously.

The name of the bucket to create. Must not be null.
Additional options for the operation. May be null, in which case appropriate defaults will be used.
member.returns: The resource representation of the newly-created bucket.

Additional options for the operation. May be null, in which case appropriate defaults will be used.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation, with a result returning the resource representation of the newly-created bucket.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.CreateBucket(System.String,Google.Apis.Storage.v1.Data.Bucket,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.CreateBucketOptions)
member.summary: Creates a storage bucket synchronously.
member.param: The ID of the project to create the buckets in. Must not be null.
The resource representation of the bucket to create. Must not be null, and must have a name.
Additional options for the operation. May be null, in which case appropriate defaults will be used.
member.returns: The resource representation of the newly-created bucket.

member.param: The ID of the project to create the buckets in. Must not be null.
The resource representation of the bucket to create. Must not be null, and must have a name.
Additional options for the operation. May be null, in which case appropriate defaults will be used.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation, with a result returning the resource representation of the newly-created bucket.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.Service
member.summary: The underlying storage service object used by this client.
member.remarks: The class only provides convenience operations built on top of an existing service object. Any more complex operations which are not supported by this wrapper may wish to use the same service object as the wrapper, in order to take advantage of its configuration (for authentication, application naming etc).

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.EncryptionKey
member.summary: The encryption key used by default for all relevant object-based operations. This can be overridden in call-specific options. This will never return null in the built-in implementation; if no encryption key is specified, is returned.

member.summary: Asynchronously creates a , using application default credentials if no credentials are specified.
member.remarks: The credentials are scoped as necessary.
member.param: Optional .
Optional to use for all relevant object-based operations by default. May be null.
member.returns: The task representing the created .

member.remarks: The credentials are scoped as necessary.
member.param: Optional .
Optional to use for all relevant object-based operations by default. May be null.
member.returns: The created .

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.DeleteObject(System.String,System.String,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.DeleteObjectOptions)
member.summary: Deletes a version of the specified object synchronously.

remarks.para: By default this will delete the latest version of the object, but this can be controlled using . For buckets that support multiple versions, implicitly deleting the latest version only archives it so the object is still available and can be listed by specifying . If the version is explicitly specified, the object is permanently deleted.

If the bucket containing the object supports versioning, after this operation completes successfully there may still be another version of the same object. In buckets which do not support versioning, this operation will permanently delete the object.
If the request attempts to delete an object that does not exist or a specific version that does not exist, this counts as a failure with an HTTP status code of 404.

member.param: The name of the bucket containing the object. Must not be null.
The name of the object within the bucket. Must not be null.
Additional options for the operation. May be null, in which case appropriate defaults will be used.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.DeleteObjectAsync(System.String,System.String,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.DeleteObjectOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deletes a version of the specified object asynchronously.

remarks.para: By default this will delete the latest version of the object, but this can be controlled using . For buckets that support multiple versions, implicitly deleting the latest version only archives it so the object is still available and can be listed by specifying . If the version is explicitly specified, the object is permanently deleted.

If the bucket containing the object supports versioning, after this operation completes successfully there may still be another version of the same object. In buckets which do not support versioning, this operation will permanently delete the object.
If the request attempts to delete an object that does not exist or a specific version that does not exist, this counts as a failure with an HTTP status code of 404.

member.param: The name of the bucket containing the object. Must not be null.
The name of the object within the bucket. Must not be null.
Additional options for the operation. May be null, in which case appropriate defaults will be used.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.DeleteObject(Google.Apis.Storage.v1.Data.Object,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.DeleteObjectOptions)
member.summary: Deletes a version of the specified object synchronously.

remarks.para: By default this will delete the latest version of the object, but this can be controlled using . Note that any generation information contained within is ignored; the generation to delete is only controlled via . For buckets that support multiple versions, implicitly deleting the latest version only archives it so the object is still available and can be listed by specifying . If the version is explicitly specified, the object is permanently deleted.

If the bucket containing the object supports versioning, after this operation completes successfully there may still be another version of the same object. In buckets which do not support versioning, this operation will permanently delete the object.
If the request attempts to delete an object that does not exist or a specific version that does not exist, this counts as a failure with an HTTP status code of 404.

member.param: Object to delete. Must not be null, and must have the name and bucket populated.
Additional options for the operation. May be null, in which case appropriate defaults will be used.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.DeleteObjectAsync(Google.Apis.Storage.v1.Data.Object,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.DeleteObjectOptions,System.Threading.CancellationToken)

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.ListBucketsAsync(System.String,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.ListBucketsOptions)
member.summary: Asynchronously lists the buckets in a given project.
member.remarks: This method fetches the buckets lazily, making requests to the underlying service for a page of results at a time, as required.
member.param: The ID of the project to list the buckets from. Must not be null.
The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
member.returns: An asynchronous sequence of buckets.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.ListBuckets(System.String,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.ListBucketsOptions)
member.summary: Lists the buckets for a given project, synchronously but lazily.
member.remarks: This method fetches the buckets lazily, making requests to the underlying service for a page of results at a time, as required.
member.param: The ID of the project to list the buckets from. Must not be null.
The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
member.returns: A sequence of buckets within the project.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.ListObjectsAsync(System.String,System.String,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.ListObjectsOptions)
member.summary: Asynchronously lists the objects in a given bucket.
member.remarks: This method fetches the objects lazily, making requests to the underlying service for a page of results at a time, as required.
member.param: The bucket to list the objects from. Must not be null.
The prefix to match. Only objects with names that start with this string will be returned. This parameter may be null or empty, in which case no filtering is performed.
The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
member.returns: An asynchronous sequence of objects in the specified bucket.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClient.ListObjects(System.String,System.String,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.ListObjectsOptions)

The options for the operation. May be null, in which case defaults will be supplied.
member.returns: A sequence of objects in the specified bucket.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClientImpl
member.summary: Wrapper around to provide simpler operations.
member.remarks: This is the "default" implementation of . Most client code should refer to , creating instances with and . The constructor of this class is public for the sake of constructor-based dependency injection.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClientImpl.ApplicationName
member.summary: The default application name used when creating a . Defaults to "google-cloud-dotnet"; must not be null.
member.remarks: Most applications will never want to set this, which is why it's in this class rather than .

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClientImpl.#ctor(Google.Apis.Storage.v1.StorageService,Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.EncryptionKey)
member.summary: Constructs a new client wrapping the given .
member.param: The service to wrap. Must not be null.
Optional to use for object-based operations by default. May be null, in which case will be used.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClientImpl.ValidBucketName
member.summary: Regular expression to be used for bucket validation when would throw the wrong exception.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClientImpl.ValidateBucketName(System.String)
member.summary: Validates that a bucket only contains valid characters, and is not too long. This is far from complete validation, but is all that's required to ensure that it's safe to include in a URL. This method also checks for nullity, so callers don't need to do that first. This method is internal rather than private for testing purposes.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClientImpl.ValidateBucket(Google.Apis.Storage.v1.Data.Bucket,System.String)
member.summary: Validates that the given Bucket has a "somewhat valid" (no URI encoding required) bucket name.
member.param: Bucket to validate
The parameter name in the calling method

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClientImpl.ValidateObject(Google.Apis.Storage.v1.Data.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Validates that the given Object has a "somewhat valid" (no URI encoding required) bucket name and an object name.
member.param: Object to validate
The parameter name in the calling method

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClientImpl.GetBaseUri(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs the media URL of an object from its bucket and name. This does not include the generation or any GaxPreconditions. The returned string will always have a query parameter, so later query parameters can unconditionally be appended with an "&" prefix.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.StorageClientImpl.GetBaseUri(Google.Apis.Storage.v1.Data.Object)
member.summary: Obtains the media URL of an object from its bucket and name. The returned string will always have a query parameter, so later query parameters can unconditionally be appended with an "&" prefix.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateBucketOptions
member.summary: Options for UpdateBucket operations.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateBucketOptions.IfMetagenerationMatch
member.summary: Precondition for update: the bucket is only updated if its current meta-generation matches the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateBucketOptions.IfMetagenerationNotMatch
member.summary: Precondition for update: the bucket is only updated if its current meta-generation does not match the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateBucketOptions.Projection
member.summary: The projection of the updated object to return.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateBucketOptions.PredefinedAcl
member.summary: A pre-defined ACL of the bucket for simple access control scenarios.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateBucketOptions.PredefinedDefaultObjectAcl
member.summary: A pre-defined default ACL for objects created in the bucket, for simple access control scenarios.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateBucketOptions.ForceNoPreconditions
member.summary: If set to true, no other preconditions must be set, and the local metageneration of the bucket being updated is not used to create a precondition.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateObjectOptions
member.summary: Options for UpdateObject operations.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateObjectOptions.Generation
member.summary: If present, selects a specific revision of this object (as opposed to the latest version, the default).

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateObjectOptions.IfGenerationMatch
member.summary: Precondition for update: the object is only updated if the existing object's generation matches the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateObjectOptions.IfGenerationNotMatch
member.summary: Precondition for update: the object is only updated if the existing object's generation does not match the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateObjectOptions.IfMetagenerationMatch
member.summary: Precondition for update: the object is only updated if the existing object's meta-generation matches the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateObjectOptions.IfMetagenerationNotMatch
member.summary: Precondition for update: the object is only updated if the existing object's meta-generation does not match the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateObjectOptions.Projection
member.summary: The projection of the updated object to return.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateObjectOptions.PredefinedAcl
member.summary: A pre-defined ACL for simple access control scenarios.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateObjectOptions.ForceNoPreconditions
member.summary: If set to true, no other preconditions must be set, and the local metageneration of the object being updated is not used to create a precondition.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UpdateObjectOptions.EncryptionKey
member.summary: The encryption key to use for this operation. If this property is null, the will be used instead. Use to remove encryption headers from this request.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UploadObjectOptions
member.summary: Options for UploadObject operations.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UploadObjectOptions.MinimumChunkSize
member.summary: The minimum chunk size for uploading.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UploadObjectOptions.IfGenerationMatch
member.summary: Precondition for upload: the object is only uploaded if the existing object's generation matches the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UploadObjectOptions.IfGenerationNotMatch
member.summary: Precondition for upload: the object is only uploaded if the existing object's generation does not match the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UploadObjectOptions.IfMetagenerationMatch
member.summary: Precondition for upload: the object is only uploaded if the existing object's meta-generation matches the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UploadObjectOptions.IfMetagenerationNotMatch
member.summary: Precondition for upload: the object is only uploaded if the existing object's meta-generation does not match the given value.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UploadObjectOptions.ChunkSize
member.summary: The chunk size to use for each request. When setting to a non-null value, this must be a positive multiple of .

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UploadObjectOptions.PredefinedAcl
member.summary: A pre-defined ACL for simple access control scenarios.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UploadObjectOptions.Projection
member.summary: The projection of the uploaded object to retrieve.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UploadObjectOptions.EncryptionKey
member.summary: The encryption key to use for this operation. If this property is null, the will be used instead. Use to remove encryption headers from this request.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UrlSigner
member.summary: Class which helps create signed URLs which can be used to provide limited access to specific buckets and objects to anyone in possession of the URL, regardless of whether they have a Google account.
member.remarks: See https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/access-control/signed-urls for more information on signed URLs.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UrlSigner.ResumableHttpMethod
member.summary: Gets a special HTTP method which can be used to create a signed URL for initiating a resumable upload. See https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/access-control/signed-urls#signing-resumable for more information.
member.remarks: Note: When using the RESUMABLE method to create a signed URL, a URL will actually be signed for the POST method with a header of 'x-goog-resumable:start'. The caller must perform a POST request with this URL and specify the 'x-goog-resumable:start' header as well or signature validation will fail.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UrlSigner.FromServiceAccountPath(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance for a service account.
member.param: The path to the JSON key file for a service account. Must not be null.
member.exception: The does not refer to a valid JSON service account key file.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UrlSigner.FromServiceAccountData(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new instance for a service account.
member.param: The stream from which to read the JSON key data for a service account. Must not be null.
member.exception: The does not contain valid JSON service account key data.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UrlSigner.FromServiceAccountCredential(Google.Apis.Auth.OAuth2.ServiceAccountCredential)
member.summary: Creates a new instance for a service account.
member.param: The credential for the a service account. Must not be null.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UrlSigner.Sign(System.String,System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage)
member.summary: Creates a signed URL which can be used to provide limited access to specific buckets and objects to anyone in possession of the URL, regardless of whether they have a Google account.

remarks.para: When the is specified, some of its headers will be included in the signed URL's signature, and therefore must be included in requests made with the created URL. These are the Content-MD5 and Content-Type content headers as well as any content or request header with a name starting with "x-goog-".
If is null, no headers are included in the signed URL's signature, so any requests made with the created URL must not contain Content-MD5, Content-Type, or any header starting with "x-goog-".

Note that if the entity is encrypted with customer-supplied encryption keys (see https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/encryption for more information), the x-goog-encryption-algorithm, x-goog-encryption-key, and x-goog-encryption-key-sha256 headers will be required when making the request. However, only the x-goog-encryption-algorithm header is included in the signature for the signed URL. So the sample specified only needs to have the x-goog-encryption-algorithm request header. The other headers can be included, but will be ignored.
Note that when GET is specified as the , both GET and HEAD requests can be made with the created signed URL.
See https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/access-control/signed-urls for more information on signed URLs.

member.param: The name of the bucket. Must not be null.
The name of the object within the bucket. May be null, in which case the signed URL will refer to the bucket instead of an object.
The length of time for which the signed URL should remain usable.
A sample request for which the signed URL might be used. May be null.
member.returns: The signed URL which can be used to provide access to a bucket or object for a limited amount of time.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Storage.V1.UrlSigner.Sign(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage)
member.summary: Creates a signed URL which can be used to provide limited access to specific buckets and objects to anyone in possession of the URL, regardless of whether they have a Google account.

remarks.para: When the is specified, some of its headers will be included in the signed URL's signature, and therefore must be included in requests made with the created URL. These are the Content-MD5 and Content-Type content headers as well as any content or request header with a name starting with "x-goog-".
If is null, no headers are included in the signed URL's signature, so any requests made with the created URL must not contain Content-MD5, Content-Type, or any header starting with "x-goog-".

Note that if the entity is encrypted with customer-supplied encryption keys (see https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/encryption for more information), the x-goog-encryption-algorithm, x-goog-encryption-key, and x-goog-encryption-key-sha256 headers will be required when making the request. However, only the x-goog-encryption-algorithm header is included in the signature for the signed URL. So the sample specified only needs to have the x-goog-encryption-algorithm request header. The other headers can be included, but will be ignored.
Note that when GET is specified as the , both GET and HEAD requests can be made with the created signed URL.
See https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/access-control/signed-urls for more information on signed URLs.

member.param: The name of the bucket. Must not be null.
The name of the object within the bucket. May be null, in which case the signed URL will refer to the bucket instead of an object.
The point in time after which the signed URL will be invalid. May be null, in which case the signed URL never expires.
A sample request for which the signed URL might be used. May be null.
member.returns: The signed URL which can be used to provide access to a bucket or object for a limited amount of time.

member.summary: Creates a signed URL which can be used to provide limited access to specific buckets and objects to anyone in possession of the URL, regardless of whether they have a Google account.

remarks.para: When either of the headers collections are specified, there are certain headers which will be included in the signed URL's signature, and therefore must be included in requests made with the created URL. These are the Content-MD5 and Content-Type content headers as well as any content or request header with a name starting with "x-goog-".

If the headers collections are null or empty, no headers are included in the signed URL's signature, so any requests made with the created URL must not contain Content-MD5, Content-Type, or any header starting with "x-goog-".

Note that if the entity is encrypted with customer-supplied encryption keys (see https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/encryption for more information), the x-goog-encryption-algorithm, x-goog-encryption-key, and x-goog-encryption-key-sha256 headers will be required when making the request. However, only the x-goog-encryption-algorithm header is included in the signature for the signed URL. So the specified only need to have the x-goog-encryption-algorithm header. The other headers can be included, but will be ignored.
Note that when GET is specified as the (or it is null, in which case GET is used), both GET and HEAD requests can be made with the created signed URL.
See https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/access-control/signed-urls for more information on signed URLs.

member.param: The name of the bucket. Must not be null.
The name of the object within the bucket. May be null, in which case the signed URL will refer to the bucket instead of an object.
The length of time for which the signed URL should remain usable.
The HTTP request method for which the signed URL is allowed to be used. May be null, in which case GET will be used.
The headers which will be included with the request. May be null.
The headers for the content which will be included with the request. May be null.
member.returns: The signed URL which can be used to provide access to a bucket or object for a limited amount of time.

member.summary: Creates a signed URL which can be used to provide limited access to specific buckets and objects to anyone in possession of the URL, regardless of whether they have a Google account.

remarks.para: When either of the headers collections are specified, there are certain headers which will be included in the signed URL's signature, and therefore must be included in requests made with the created URL. These are the Content-MD5 and Content-Type content headers as well as any content or request header with a name starting with "x-goog-".

If the headers collections are null or empty, no headers are included in the signed URL's signature, so any requests made with the created URL must not contain Content-MD5, Content-Type, or any header starting with "x-goog-".

Note that if the entity is encrypted with customer-supplied encryption keys (see https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/encryption for more information), the x-goog-encryption-algorithm, x-goog-encryption-key, and x-goog-encryption-key-sha256 headers will be required when making the request. However, only the x-goog-encryption-algorithm header is included in the signature for the signed URL. So the specified only need to have the x-goog-encryption-algorithm header. The other headers can be included, but will be ignored.
Note that when GET is specified as the (or it is null, in which case GET is used), both GET and HEAD requests can be made with the created signed URL.
See https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/access-control/signed-urls for more information on signed URLs.

member.param: The name of the bucket. Must not be null.
The name of the object within the bucket. May be null, in which case the signed URL will refer to the bucket instead of an object.
The point in time after which the signed URL will be invalid. May be null, in which case the signed URL never expires.
The HTTP request method for which the signed URL is allowed to be used. May be null, in which case GET will be used.
The headers which will be included with the request. May be null.
The headers for the content which will be included with the request. May be null.
member.returns: The signed URL which can be used to provide access to a bucket or object for a limited amount of time.
